result.execSummary:
The defendant NANCY A SWITON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -No huber, out-of-county service or out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-No Violent contact with the victims Kaylee Switon, Catherine Knoch. and Luis Guzman.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NANCY A SWITON

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant NANCY A SWITON in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for NANCY A SWITON. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation and conditions. DA concurs. Atty Zamzow concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year. No huber, out of county service or out of count travel.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-No Violent contact with the victims Kaylee Switon, Catherine Knoch. and Luis Guzman.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 2:08 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Second appearance on March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No Contact with KS. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department

No Contact with KS. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department

9:46 AM Defendant NANCY A SWITON appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with KS. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of Counsel on March 23, 2022 at 9:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:49 AM.
